Text description: 20 geared brushed DC motors (Underactuated). Tendon-driven. Shadow Tactile Sensing (STF) acheived with magnets and 3-axis Hall effect sensor (Only on the index and thumb by default). Full ROS integration. Motors stored in the base of the hand. Tendons susceptible to wearing down after excessive use.

15 DC motors (Overactuated). Tendon-driven.  Distal tactile sensors with optional middle and proximal sensors that use magnets and 3-axis Hall Effect. Full ROS integration. Modular fingers and tactile sensors. Motors stored in the base of each finger. Backdrivable. More durable than Shadow Dexterous Hands.

12 brushless DC motors. Quasi-Direct Drive (QDD). Tactile array sensors (>100 points) on each finger. Backdrivable. The thumb can be used for a pinky position to improve grip stability. Supports Linux, SDK, and ROS.
16 DC motors. Gear-driven. Omni-directional capacitive pressure-sensitive tactile sensors. Different fingertips for different grips. Supports ROS.
16 DC motors. Gear-driven. No tactile sensing built-in. Supports Linux, Windows, and ROS. Widely used for dexterity research.
9 servomotors (Underactuated). Gear/spindle-driven. No tactile sensing built-in. Supports ROS and can be controlled with Raspberry Pi. Left and right variants available.
6 DC motors (Underactuated). Tendon-driven. Tactile sensing with the use of flexible PCB that house three barometric pressure sensors cast in silicone. Used in prosthesis and robotics.
Unknown number and type of actuators. Tendon-driven. High resolution touch sensors. The specifications are not finalized. Planned to release in 2028.   *not finalized
6 DC motors. Gear-driven. Optional force sensors (not released). Modular fingers. Rubberized surfaces on fingers and palm.
Tactile sensors in fingertips, cameras in palm. hand contains all actuators
